title: (x) Thrilling Designs/The Taxonomy of Thrill - Kursivschrift {Youri}
content:
can anyone tell me this one?   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050515203440im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/69337.jpg)   
   
thanks in advance.   
pic from the people at HyperKit
author: jondj24

comments.content: As the wizards here haven't made a stab at it, I'm guessing that it was done by the designers at Hyperkit. You could e-mail them.

the kursivschrift in light version is the one i think, look here [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/kursivschrift/kursivschriftstehhar/](http://web.archive.org/web/20050515203440/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/kursivschrift/kursivschriftstehhar/)
Good job Youri! (I knew I had seen that type before).
Wow, Youri, impressive id. This idea is unusual and well executed. Does anyone know the designer?
The Linotype Catalog does not credit anyone. I think this is an old design that they digitized, but old German fonts is not something I have much information about.
thanks william, sorry but i don't know about the designer...if someone got the name, i'm interested.
